div1.head: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, September 5, 1898
div1.p:
I found
that Dr. Norris is
out of town. I saw
Dr. Bovaard however
and got the news
from him. Many of
my old friends are
temporarily connected
with the Army.

I went up to see
Grant's tomb and
the Columbia College
Library this morning.
You must arrange
to see them while
you are here. They
are well worth
a visit go on
a cool day however.

I would go to
see you this afternoon
but it is so hot.
and my morning
trip tired me out.

I am glad I was
able to see you yesterday.

I enjoyed the call very much.
Tell Miss Van Vleck that
I enjoyed his entertainment.
It set me up, after my tiresome
trip on the cars.

I will write to you again
soon
